Media

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Media.Picture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Pixel>

    public class Picture
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Iterable<Pixel>
    This class represents a picture that can be displayed on the screen. A picture is a 2-dimensional (height,width) collection of pixels each having a color that can be displayed on a screen and stored as a JPG in a file.
    Version:
    1.0 (06/06/02), 2.0 (08/06/01), 3.0 (08/08/26), 4.0 (09/05/04), 5.0 (09/06/30), 6.0 (10/09/02), 7.0 ( 10/06/14)
    Author:
    Michael Pickard, Andrew Cheesman, David Hughes, David Hughes, David Hughes, David Hughes, David Hughes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Picture()
      Create a picture from a file provided by a dialog.
      Picture(int width, int height)
      This constructor creates a new blank (white) picture of sepcified width & height.
      Picture(java.lang.String fileName)
      Create a picture with the specified filename

    • Method Detail

      • setJFrame

        public void setJFrame(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Used by BasicForm. Tells the Picture which JFrame it is on, so that it may refresh the JFrame when updates are made to the image so they can be seen in real time.
        Parameters:
        frame - the JFrame which the picture is on

      • setCanvas

        public void setCanvas(BasicIO.GeneralCanvas gc)
        Used by BasicForm. This method informs the Picture of which Canvas it is being drawn to so it can inform the individual pixels and pixel changes can be seen in real time.
        Parameters:
        gc - the canvas the picture is being drawn to

        public Pixel getPixel(int x,
                      int y)
        This method returns a single Pixel object
        Parameters:
